alert.note: Alert for Southern Twin Falls County; Western Magic Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Twin Falls and eastern Jerome Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 247 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kimberly to near Rock Creek. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kimberly around 250 PM MDT. Hansen and Murtaugh around 300 PM MDT. Hazelton, Eden and Milner Dam around 310 PM MDT. Minidoka National Monument around 320 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern Twin Falls County; Western Magic Valley
